p: Molecular docking is a tool in computer aided drug designing (CADD) which is used to study the binding interaction between the potential inhibitors, known as ligands, and targeted enzymes [ 24]. The X-ray crystal structures of AChE from various species can be found in the protein data bank (PDB) [ 25]. The identification of residues that are responsible for inhibitory activity will lead to potential for the synthesis of agents with a high efficacy of biological action [ 26].
